text: Hucknall, which used to be called Hucknall Torkard, is an English town near Nottingham. It is mostly a dormitory town for Nottingham. It is 11 km (7 mi) north of Nottingham.Ordnance Survey website It is the final resting place of Lord Byron, an English poet and Greek War of Independence leader,Pevsner, N. (1951) Nottinghamshire. Harmondsworth: Penguin; pp. 85â€“86 and Ada Lovelace, a famous mathematician and programmer.St. Mary Magdelene parish church , accessed 25 September 2008. == References == Category:Towns in Nottinghamshire Category:Market towns in England
title: Hucknall
